title: ID Font Requests
content:
I'd like the fonts for "THE BEST OF BLONDIE" and the song titles.

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Blondie_4562.jpg)
author: G-W

comments.content:
Actually, I'd like the font for song titles here, not above:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Blondie2_5133.jpg)

The "G" is quite distinctive.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Blondie3_4809.jpg)

Thanks again.

Thanks for Quest.

Anyone know the font for the letters on the blue background?

I know the font of the main title "Besto of Blondie": Quest RR Bold

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/quest-rr/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/quest-rr/bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/quest-rr/bold/")

and the song titles fonts is: Adelon Serial Medium.

[http://www.fonts101.com/previews/897/AdelonSerialMedium\_font\_preview\_435...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.fonts101.com/previews/897/AdelonSerialMedium_font_preview_43584_2.png "http://www.fonts101.com/previews/897/AdelonSerialMedium\_font\_preview\_43584\_2.png")

Hope you find it useful.

Mario

"THE BEST OF BLONDIE": confirming [Quest](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/quest-rr/)  
First sample song titles and text: possibly [Optima](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/optima)  
Second sample song titles: [Adelon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/adelon-serial) is Softmaker version of [Albertus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/albertus) (see [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/typophile.com/node/93218#comment-510520) for more implementors of it). Bitstream version [Flareserif 821](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/flareserif-821) is another option to get such boldness. There are also [some extra-bold versions of Albertus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014194646/http:/typophile.com/node/27712) (Alaska) shipped by HP and Brother with their laser printers.
Could the second set of song titles and names be Fritz Quadrata?
